sen.j: 梶川 正教（かじかわ まさのり）は戦国時代 (日本)、安土桃山時代の武将。
sen.e: Masanori KAJIKAWA was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period to Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 梶川氏は織田氏の庶流の一族で本姓は平氏であるが、正教の数代前に楠木氏から養子が入っているという。
sen.e: Kajikawa clan was a branch family of Oda clan and main name was Taira clan, but an adopted child from Kusunoki clan entered in the line from several generations before Masanori.

sen.cmt: main nameをits original surname に書き換えました。またseveral の前のfromを削除しました。
sen.e: Kajikawa clan was a branch family of Oda clan and its original surname was Taira clan, but an adopted child from Kusunoki clan entered in the line several generations before Masanori.

sen.j: 足利義昭が槙島城にて反旗を翻したときは先陣を務め、感状と名馬をさずけられた。
sen.e: He led the van when Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA raised a standard of revolt at Makishima-jo Castle and he was rewarded with a letter of commendation for taking part in the battle and a famous horse.

He was in the vanguard in the battle against Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who had risen in revolt at Makishima-jo Castle, and he was rewarded with a letter of commendation for taking part in the battle and a fine horse.
sen.cmt: 逐語訳過ぎて梶川方が足利と戦ったことがわからないので前半を書き換えました。
sen.e: He was in the vanguard in the battle against Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who had risen in revolt at Makishima-jo Castle, and he was rewarded with a letter of commendation for taking part in the battle and a fine horse.

sen.j: 後に豊臣秀吉に仕えた。
